DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Clinician Assessment Upper GI Response Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term that represents the chronic graft versus host disease response for upper gastrointestinal tract based on clinician assessment.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Clinician Assessment Upper Gastrointestinal Tract Disease Response
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation._An individual, such as a physician or nurse practitioner, who takes responsibility for a patient's care during an encounter._The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of._The upper part of the gastrointestinal tract that includes the esophagus, stomach, and duodenum._The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A graft versus host disease with symptoms appearing more than 100 days post-transplant.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

Property.preferredName: Clinician Assessment Upper Gastrointestinal Tract Disease Response
Property.preferredDefinition: An individual, such as a physician or nurse practitioner, who takes responsibility for a patient's care during an encounter.:The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.:The upper part of the gastrointestinal tract that includes the esophagus, stomach, and duodenum.:The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

Concepts.definition: An individual, such as a physician or nurse practitioner, who takes responsibility for a patient's care during an encounter.
The final result of a determination of the value, significance, or extent of.
The upper part of the gastrointestinal tract that includes the esophagus, stomach, and duodenum.
The pathologic and/or clinical changes that result from treatment. The changes may include eradication of detectable disease, stabilization of disease, or disease progression.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Created for CCR 16C0094 study as requested by P.Asangong. mc 4/25/16

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: NIH Upper GI Score 0 after previous involvement

ValueMeaning.preferredName: NIH Upper GI Score 0 after previous involvement
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An NIH upper GI score of 0 after previous GvHD involvement.

Concepts.definition: An NIH upper GI score of 0 after previous GvHD involvement.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Decrease NIH Upper GI Score by 1 or more points

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Decrease NIH Upper GI Score by 1 or more points
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An NIH upper GI score that has decreased by 1 or more points.

Concepts.definition: An NIH upper GI score that has decreased by 1 or more points.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Increase in NIH Upper GI Score by 1 or more points, except 0 to 1

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Increase in NIH Upper GI Score by 1 or more points, except 0 to 1
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An NIH upper GI score that has increased by 1 or more points, except 0 to 1.

Concepts.definition: An NIH upper GI score that has increased by 1 or more points, except 0 to 1.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Category; used informally to mean a class of things.

Concepts.definition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created for CCR 16C0094 study as requested by P.Asangong. mc 4/25/16
